q: reality TV's harshest judge. But in person, he's all about being zen. Just ask Idol expert Richard Rushfield, author of the new tell-all, American Idol: The Untold Story. We met at his huge office at Sony in London, which was two enormous rooms with lit candles, ginger tea and crutatae. He was very open. He wanted to know all the dirt I had heard about him. He did not respond defensively at all when I told him some of the unpleasant things that were in the book, Rushfield tells TVGuide.com. that," Roger Goodell said. Speaking at his annual Super Bowl news conference on Friday, the commissioner said he's spoken with Michael Vick three times in the last two weeks about his plans. I want to make sure that he doesn't put himself in a position where he's going to make bad decisions or bad things can happen around him, Roger Goodell said. "He takes that seriously also." The Minnesota game cost him. But after what he saw from Michael Vick this season, Eagles offensive coordinator Marty Mornhinweg thinks the 30-year-old has a chance- a chance- to become a great one. He's got a good opportunity to become one of the best ever, Marty Mornhinweg told me on Thursday. "He's got several things to do to get that done." The Anbar Awakening-which Mr. Donald Rumsfeld credits as beginning in the fall of 2006- had convinced a lot of Sunnis they didn't want to be associated with al Qaeda, and "the government of Iraq was evolving the ability to take on some of the radicals" with the help of Iraqi security forces that had become "very capable." Eric Schmidt dodges talk of becoming future Apple CEO Google chairman Eric Schmidt is sidestepping discussion of whether he might become the next Apple CEO. In the first place, it's not appropriate. Steve[ Jobs] is still the CEO and I hope he continues forever, Eric Schmidt told CNBC in a Monday interview. In response to whether or not Apple has approached him to make an offer, however, Eric Schmidt would neither confirm or deny the suggestion. "I'm not going to

there's going to be a few surprises, I genuinely do." However, he admitted that no one had been asked to appear on the new series just yet. He continued: No one's been contracted yet- apart from me. I'm gon na make an announcement in two weeks' time. Simon Cowell would take lessons he's learned from other shows though- new judges David Hasselhoff and comedian David Hasselhoff MacIntyre were added to the panel on show Britain's Got Talent.
